meanings.definition: A countless or extremely great number
meanings.sent1: There was a myriad of stars twinkling in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The beach was covered with a myriad of seashells of all shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had a myriad of papers to grade before the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The forest was a myriad of colors in the autumn sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline was a myriad of lights at night, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.sent1: She was amazed by the myriad options available at the ice cream shop.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with a myriad variety of flowers in full bloom.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a myriad of colorful scarves out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The artist's palette held a myriad of vibrant colors waiting to be used.
meanings.sent5: The library shelves were filled with a myriad collection of books on every subject imaginable.
